Module com.example.umlscd
Package com.example.umlscd.PresentationLayer.ClassDiagram

Class InterfaceEditorUI

java.lang.Object
com.example.umlscd.PresentationLayer.ClassDiagram.InterfaceEditorUI
public class InterfaceEditorUI extends Object

Interface Editor UI

The InterfaceEditorUI class manages the user interface for editing UML interfaces. It provides functionalities such as adding methods, specifying method visibility, adding method parameters, and applying changes to the model based on user input.

It interacts with the InterfaceEditorManager to handle the underlying logic and updates the interface's properties, including its name, methods, and parameters.

Authors: Ahmad Wyne, Wahaj Asif, Muhammad Muneeb

Version: 1.0

Since: 2024-12-04

  • Constructor Details

    • InterfaceEditorUI

      public InterfaceEditorUI()
      Default constructor that initializes the InterfaceEditorManager.

      This constructor initializes the manager which handles the interface editing logic.

  • Method Details

    • setClassDiagramManager

      public void setClassDiagramManager(ClassDiagramManager manager)
      Sets the ClassDiagramManager reference and updates the InterfaceEditorManager.

      This method allows the InterfaceEditorUI to interact with the ClassDiagramManager instance, which is responsible for managing the UML diagram. The ClassEditorManager is also updated with the reference to allow consistent diagram editing.

      Parameters:
      manager - The ClassDiagramManager instance to be set.

    • setInterfaceBox

      public void setInterfaceBox(javafx.scene.layout.VBox interfaceBox, UMLInterfaceBox umlInterfaceBox)
      Sets the interfaceBox and populates the editor fields with existing interface data.

      This method is called when an existing UML interface is selected. It populates the interface editor with the current name, and methods of the UML interface.

      Parameters:
      interfaceBox - The VBox representing the class in the UI.
      umlInterfaceBox - The UMLInterfaceBox model object containing interface data.

    • applyHoverEffect

      public void applyHoverEffect(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      Applies a hover effect to a button when the mouse is hovered over it.

      This method changes the background color and scale of the button to provide a visual indication that it is being hovered over.

      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The mouse event triggered when the mouse is over the button.

    • removeHoverEffect

      public void removeHoverEffect(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      Removes the hover effect from a button when the mouse is no longer hovering over it.

      This method resets the background color and scale of the button to its default state.

      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The mouse event triggered when the mouse leaves the button.

    • applyClickEffect

      public void applyClickEffect(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      Applies a click effect to a button when it is clicked.

      This method changes the background color and style of the button when clicked to provide feedback to the user.

      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The mouse event triggered when the button is clicked.

    • getEditorNode

      public javafx.scene.layout.VBox getEditorNode()
      Provides access to the root node of ClassEditorUI.

      This method returns the root VBox node, which can be used to integrate the class editor UI into other parts of the application.

      Returns:
      The root VBox of ClassEditorUI.
